intro: Cossinia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar cossinia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
